body:
That's expected behavior think about it when you building a native form without React's state, when input is removed its state will get lost as well. I think it's important to understand the rationale behind the design.

However, in v6 we do have the option to not lost input state after unmount, `shouldUnregister`: https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/releases/tag/v6.0.0-rc.4

by the way, another easy option is just toggle the visibility with `display: 'none'`

@bluebill1049 Thank you for explaining. 
Yeah, I understand why you have this pattern, so you can dynamically manipulate final Form's state by adding or removing form's elements in render if needed, sure this can be useful in some cases. 

I do use `display: 'none'` workaround and it works as expected without losing `formValues` will try `shouldUnregister: false` as well, thanks for the tip.

Thanks again on doing a great job with `react-hook-form`, thank you for many useful features to covering all use cases. üëç 

P.S: `shouldUnregister: false` - works as well üëç
@kurdin awesome to hear! thank you too üôè

@bluebill1049 sorry to reopen but I added ` shouldUnregister: false` to my example above and it seems like `formValues` still empty after Form shows and `setValue("ageGroup", val);` not working at all on line 26. This is definitely looks like a bug. 

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-set-inputselect-value-z87ce
can you share the steps to reproduce?

just reproduced the issue: https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-set-inputselect-value-mcbx6?file=/src/index.js

patching it.
This issue above needs some careful consideration, we will delay the release of this after V6.

hey @paulkarpenko take a look at this codesandbox for v5 https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-conditional-inputs-c7n0r.

with v6 `shouldUnregsiter` input value will remain even component gets unmounted, the question is should we support setValue, watch, getValues for unmounted inputs within the team. I will keep you guys updated.

Thank you for the prompt reply, @bluebill1049!

I don't believe this example captures my usecase because the `mail` field in the modal isn't part of the same form as the other fields. My modal form fields use the same context as the main form, and when the field array in the modal gets unmounted, I can no longer see the array values with `getValues()`

I've updated my example to show my issue more clearly: https://codesandbox.io/s/serene-heisenberg-j2v4t
If the array fields are hidden, and you reset them to a value, `getValues()` will not show the values after the next re-render.
@paulkarpenko Thanks for the codesandbox, i think that's this PR https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/pull/1994 try to fix.
